content.description:
The Tooth Fairy 5.9 *** (185') F(19b)

Begin 10' left of "Swiftly" and climb up the face right of the large flake and right of the arete/crack on the left to the two ring anchors in an alcove just below the top. Can be done as two pitches to the mid face anchor chains;

P1 - 5.9 *** 90' F(9b) - to hanging belay at chains (with extra bolt).

P2 - 5.9 ** 95' F(9b) - eases up for the top 40'
content.protection: Fixed - 19 bolts to the two ring anchors on top.
content.location: On the face just left of Swiftly

content.description:
Swiftly - 5.9- *** (200’) F(21b)

Climb the middle of the large grey face left of the main arcing corner system at the far north end of the Red-tail Wall. Sustained moderate climbing leads to a high mantle move and then the exciting and airy finish. It's possible to rap the route with a single 60m rope. Can be done in one long pitch with a 60m rope and longer draws, or as two pitches (with a semi-hanging belay with extra bolt in the middle);

P1 - 5.8 *** 100' F (10b)

P2 - 5.9- *** 100' F (10b)
content.location: Begin about 30' left of the large corner system with the arcing top (that marks the north end of this crag), and climb directly up. Chain anchors at mid way and the top.

content.description:
Redtail 5.9- *** (200') M(15b)

Begin 15' right of "Swiftly" (and 15' left of the big corner) and climb directly up to the 2 chain anchors on top. Can be done as one long pitch with a 60m rope straightened out with some long draws, but probably best done as two. Sustained, moderate, interesting climbing on mostly excellent rock with an exciting finish makes for a great adventure.

P1 - 5.9- *** (95') F(10b) - fun, sustained, reachy climbing to the 2 chain anchors with extra bolt at mid-face.

P2 - 5.7 *** (105') M(5b) - after an easy section, above the 3 bolt semi-hanging belay over some hollow flakes, head up and left through the weakness in the roof. Several bolts help protect this mostly trad upper pitch (with a wide range of horizontal cam placements from tiny to large).
content.protection: Mixed - 15 bolts (green hangers) and several pieces of gear (#00 to #3 cams - with doubles of #2), 2 chain anchors at mid level and top.
content.location: On the tall wall just left of the large corner system that marks the right edge of the Red-tail Wall.

content.description:
Quetzalcoatl - 5.10c*** (175') M(11b)

Climbs the far left side of the upper face (beginning about 50' right of the end of the wide terrace at the base), can be done as two pitches;

P1 - 5.10c *** (100') F(11b) - thin face climbing to the chain anchors in the corner (eases up after the crux middle section).

P2 - 5.9 ** (75') G - moderate but progressively harder moves up the dihedral lead to the 2 bolt/quick-link anchors in the small alcove about 10' below the top.
content.protection: First pitch fixed (11 bolts), second pitch gear - a full rack of cams (double #2's nice) and small stoppers needed.
content.location: At the left end of the upper face, beginning 50' right of the end of the lower terrace and 10' left of the broken diagonal flake at the bottom.

content.description:
Fledgling 5.7 ** (85') M(2b)

Begins 40' left of The Tooth Fairy at the intermittent vertical crack. Sustained 5.6-7 face and crack climbing on sometimes questionable rock leads to the two bolt/quick-link anchors on the arete. Two bolts protect the middle section where the crack temporarily peters out, and a wide range of cams and nuts are needed above and below. Despite the name this is not a beginners route.
content.protection: Mixed - 2 bolts and a wide range of cams and nuts.
content.location: 40' left of The Tooth Fairy climb the obvious crack.

content.description:
El Duderino -  5.8+ *** (70') G

Sustained trad climbing up the cracks about 20' right of the start of Dudeist Priest (using a mix of both crack and face holds). Begins good and ends great with progressively harder, mostly well protected moves. Two chains and extra bolt at stance half way up the cliff.
content.protection: Full rack of cams (#0 to 3 or 4) plus some small stoppers.
content.location: Begins just left of the big corner about 20' right of the start of Dudeist Priest. Chain anchors at the ledge mid face.

content.description:
Dudeist Priest - 5.10a *** (195') F(20b)

Climbs the blunt arete at the far right (north) end of the Red-tail Wall (just right of the large corner that arcs left at the top). Can be done as one long or two pitches;

P1 - 5.10a *** 80' F(8b) - begin at the lowest point of the toe of the small lower buttress and climb progressively harder moves (consistently great unique patin-like edges from crimpers to jugs!) to the chain anchors above the large ledge.

P2 - 5.9 *** 115' F(11b) - from the belay ledge step right to mount the easy face above to the prominent inside corner. Climb the face just right of the corner until forced into the corner. Progressively harder moves lead to the thrilling finish and the chain anchors in the alcove above the ledge on top.

Note; it is NOT possible to safely rap the route with a single 60m rope. If you want to lower after leading the 2nd pitch, a 70m rope is needed. Best to belay on the good ledge at the top and rap the fall line to meet up with the anchors at the top of El Duderino.
content.protection: fixed - 8 bolts to chain anchors at mid ledge, another 11 to chain anchors on top (a medium cam - #1 or 2 - placements is possible in the 5.4 slightly runout section above the mid belay but not essential). 20 draws to lead as one pitch.
content.location: At the far right (north) end of the Red-tail Wall climb the buttress just to the right of "Batty".

content.description:
Batty - 5.10a *** (110') F(12b)

Climbs the face right of Red-tail. Beginning about 10' right of that route climb up and diagonally right on mostly good rock with interesting route finding challenges. At the narrow ledge 2/3rds of the way up traverse right a few feet and continue directly up to the 2 chain anchors on the large ledge at mid face. It's possible to lower with a 60m rope (but not to the base of the route, if you take the fall line you end up at the base of the corner at the far right). After leading, probably best to belay on the good ledge at the top and rap the fall line.

(Pitch two is not yet finished.)
content.protection: Fixed - 12 bolts, needs some long draws on the bolts before the traverse to reduce rope drag. 2 chain anchors plus an extra pair of bolts on the large mid-level ledge.
content.location: At the far right end of Red-tail Wall, just left of the large chimney/corner.
